speaker: Ogma
text: Prince Marth, I'm Ogma, a mercenary of Talys. The king ordered me to join your forces. I brought along my three most trusted men. Welcome to Galder, the port town that's been overrun by pirates. Pirates aren't all you will have to worry about. We've spotted soldiers from Grust too. Keep your wits about you.

speaker: Woman
text: There's a pirate who goes by the name of Darros. He's looking to meet the prince! Word is he wants to turn over a new leaf and fight for the people. You should seek him out and listen to what he has to say.

speaker: Woman
text: A curate can earn EXP simply by withstanding the attacks of a foe.

speaker: Man
text: Hammers are effective against knights. It would be wise to purchase one!

speaker: Villager
text: Prince of Altea, I beg of you... Save the cleric Lena. We tried to stop her, but... she left the safety of the village to bring aid to the poor and sick. She set out toward the Ghoul's Teeth some time ago and has yet to return. I can't tell you how much Lena's help meant to us. She's like an angel. It isn't much, but...we can offer you 5,000G to aid in your efforts to rescue her. Please, do what you can to save her!

speaker: Castor
text: Please forgive me, Princess Caeda! I have no choice. I must get my hands on some money...

speaker: Caeda
text: You are Castor of Talys! Why are you fighting us?

speaker: Castor
text: Princess Caeda... I am sorry. My mother is ill. To afford her medicine, I would do anything. Even this!

speaker: Caeda
text: I see... The pirates pay you. Well, it it may not be much, but I offer you what I can. Take it, and buy medicine for your mother.

speaker: Castor
text: You would aid a traitor like me? You are so kind... Oh, Princess Caeda! Forgive me! From now on, I will dedicate my life to you.

speaker: Gomer
text: The gall of ye, defyin' me crew! I'll put an axe square between yer eyes! Ye ain't leaving here alive. I swear it on the rickety peg leg o'Shanty Pete!

speaker: Gomer
text: Augh... Fiends, ye be...

speaker: Villager
text: Thank you for taking care of those ruffians, Prince Marth. Thanks to you, peace has returned to Galder. In order to reach Aurelis, you must cross the Ghoul's Teeth. It is a dangerous road. You will find fearsome bandits called the Soothsires there. They prey on travelers and raid nearby villages. I have heard of a skilled swordsman called Navarre in their employ. Whatever you do, do not let your guard down. I will pray for your safety.

speaker: Jagen
text: Prince Marth! Princess Caeda has alighted from Talys Castle.

speaker: Marth
text: Caeda, what's wrong? Did something happen?

speaker: Caeda
text: Prince Marth! What a relief. Talys Castle is under attack from pirates of Galder! After a fierce fight, they have taken the castle. I beg you, please save my father!

speaker: Marth
text: Don't worry, Caeda. The brave knights of Altea stand ready. Pirates are no match for us! Let's head back to the castle and rescue the king!

speaker: Old Man
text: Villagers have their gates open so that the prince can visit. Don't make them wait! Once a thief attacks a village, that's it. There's no saving it.

speaker: Young Man
text: You can't use strong weapons if you don't have a high enough weapon level. That's just common sense. And don't forget that your fliers need to be careful around foes with bows!

speaker: Woman
text: There is a village south of the castle. A priest named Wrys awaits the prince there.

speaker: Man
text: Galder? It's a port town south of the isle of Talys. A man by the name of Gomer has taken control of the city. It's lousy with pirate scum!

speaker: Woman
text: If you are injured, stop at a fortress. You'll feel better after a short rest behind strong walls.

speaker: Villager
text: It is good that you have come, Prince Marth. I have here 10,000G that the villagers gathered. Take it. Please, use it to equip yourselves. Save this land from these rampaging pirates of Galder!

speaker: Gazzak
text: The might of Altea, ye say, now? Har! Ye sprogs look t’be a mite short o’mighty t’me.

speaker: Gazzak
text: Rrgh... Ye'll pay, dog...

speaker: King Of Talys
text: Prince Marth! You have done well to make it here safely. You have my thanks. So, you plan to travel to Aurelis? In that case, though they are few in number, my soldiers will join you. From Captain Ogma down, they are all brave warriors and should serve you well. That is not all. Heed me now. As you travel through these lands, you may find many who cannot tolerate the tyranny of Dolhr. Some are hiding in villages. Others have been taken prisoner. And some must work with the enemy... You must seek these people out and work together! Heed the call! The time has come! Set foot on your path, but be vigilant! You face many dangers.

speaker: Gharnef
text: So you've finally arrived, young prince... I have been waiting for you! Yes, I have waited...and I am ready to strike! Once you are dead...this world is mine! Hee hee hee! And I need not fear Medeus at all! With Falchion and Imhullu in my grasp, none can oppose me! Not even that dragon! You have journeyed far to meet me in combat... But can you find the real me? If you cannot... Falchion will never be yours!

speaker: Gharnef
text: You must not value your life very much… I will show you the true terror of the darkest of magic, Imhullu!

speaker: Gharnef
text: Gah! Starlight... Too powerful... I am undone! Know this, young prince... You may have the strength to best me... But Medeus? Ha! I will await you in hell!

speaker: Elice
text: Oh, Marth! I have missed you so. Look at how you've grown. Father would be so proud!

speaker: Marth
text: Elice! I am glad to see you safe! After I heard that Gharnef had taken you, I was so worried...

speaker: Elice
text: Gharnef kidnapped me to secure the spell of revival, Aum, that Gotoh gave me. There is a temple in southern Dolhr where this staff can be used to revive an ally... If there is one precious to you who has lost their life, let's travel to Dolhr and revive them. Let's go! To Dolhr!

speaker: Malledus
text: Your highness, please be careful inside the Fane of Raman. The goddess of this temple possesses fearful might. She will incinerate any and all intruders.

speaker: Marth
text: Hmm… I suppose we shouldn’t be intruding this sanctuary… But this temple holds the objects that I must seek. We must try not to provoke the temple’s guardians. I will only bring in a couple of soldiers with me.

speaker: Gharnef
text: Tiki... princess of the long-departed Naga clan... Incinerate all those who would disgrace the Fane of Raman! Don't forget that I saved you from Medeus after Bantu abandoned you!

speaker: Tiki
text: N-no... Don't... Don't come near me!

speaker: Bantu
text: Tiki! I've been looking everywhere! It seems Gharnef is controlling you... Now...wake up!

speaker: Tiki
text: I... I... What... What happened? Where am I?

speaker: Bantu
text: Back to your senses, are you? Good! How do you feel?

speaker: Tiki
text: It was so scary... A terrible nightmare... that wouldn't end!

speaker: Bantu
text: Oh, Tiki! I am so sorry. It's all my fault this happened! But you're all right now. I won't leave you again... I promise.

speaker: Tiki
text: Yes, please promise! Don't leave me alone ever again! Promise me that you won't...

speaker: Tiki
text: N-no! Please! Come no closer!

speaker: Tiki
text: Ban-Ban... Wh-why did you leave me?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth, can you hear me? I await you in the village north of the Macedon Aerie... Yes, I am near! If you indeed obtained the orbs, then bring them to me with haste! Without Starlight, you have no hope of taking Falchion back from Gharnef. Gharnef has retreated to Thabes, the city of illusion. Without a doubt, he has taken Elice there with him! I have protected your sister till now, but I cannot protect her forever... Hurry! Save Elice!

speaker: Caesar
text: Prince Marth, we are mercenaries hired to protect Port Warren. Grust has gathered its forces in the northern fortresses. They have put the port to siege. It's very dangerous here. But there is a castle to the east that looks a bit safer. We should make it our target. Let's head out there together without delay!

speaker: Woman
text: Many foes wait inside the fortresses, ready to enter the battle. Block them so they can't get out!

speaker: Woman
text: I've heard tell that a princess of Macedon is being held captive in Castle Deil. Macedon and Dolhr are supposed to be allies! I wonder what happened...

speaker: Old Man
text: To defeat dragons, you must use a Dragon Killer sword.

speaker: Villager
text: In the coliseum, you will be rewarded with gold and experience if you win. But if you die, you lose your life. If you want to enter, you should be mentally prepared.

speaker: Kannival
text: W-what are you doing all the way out here? Blast, I'm finished...!

speaker: Kannival
text: Long...live...Grust! Nngff...

speaker: Catria
text: Prince Marth, I am Catria of Macedon's Whitewings. I have come to you with a secret request. Princess Minerva's forces are planning to rebel against Dolhr. However, the princess's younger sister, Maria, has been taken hostage by Dolhr so we cannot act. We beg of you, please help us save the young princess!

speaker: Minerva
text: I do not agree with your strategy, General Harmein. As a knight of Macedon, I have my pride. I wish to fight them head-on. A fair battle.

speaker: Harmein
text: Many of the soldiers of Macedon were lost in Aurelis. Surely you understand this? We must regroup in the castle and stall for time. The king has put his faith in me. I would ask that you do the same. After all, if you do not trust the empire...your little sister, Maria, is the one who will suffer the consequences.

speaker: Minerva
text: ... I understand. I will leave this matter in your hands. I doubt you can defeat Altea's knights with your schemes, however... I expect that you will end up regretting this. Though she is feared by all, I have heard that she is very beautiful and kind. I wonder if anyone can help her.

speaker: Old Man
text: The warrior Minerva is actually a princess from Macedon! It is said that she fights for the Dolhr Empire because they are holding her sister hostage.

speaker: Auntie
text: The port of Warren seems to have lots of rarities for sale. If you’re going there, don’t go overboard with your shopping.

speaker: Villager
text: If you equip heavy weapons you will be slowed down by them. So equipping light but weak weapons is also a good way of fighting.

speaker: Bantu
text: Excuse me... Have you met a young girl by the name of Tiki? She is the last of the Naga, the Divine Dragon clan. There is no one but she who can defeat the manaketes serving Medeus. I'm so old that I don't have much fight left in me, but without my stone, I can't become a dragon at all. I'll come along with you, so please help me find Tiki.

speaker: Minerva
text: This fighting is more than I can stomach. Palla, Catria, Est... Let's get out of here.

speaker: Harmein
text: Curse Minerva and her pride! Grr, no matter. If I am to die here, then I won't be dying alone!

speaker: Harmein
text: Aaargh...Traitors...every...where...

speaker: Malledus
text: Prince Marth. It is time I tell you the legend of the manaketes. A long, long time ago...the manaketes arrived in Archanea. They were of three clans. The divine Dragons of Naga, the Mage Dragons of Basilisk, and the Fire Dragons of Salamander. The Divine Dragons were the most powerful. They stopped the others from conquering mankind. They carried stones that allowed them to conceal their true selves by taking human form. The dragonkin lived in peace with humans until the arrival of Medeus, an earth dragon. Medeus used his great power to destroy the Divine Dragons and found the Dolhr Empire. He launched attacks on the human lands and conquered them. Though the humans fought bravely, there was nothing they could do against Medeus. But the young warrior Anri faced Medeus! He gripped a sword that shone brightly: the blade of light, Falchion! After a fierce battle, he at last defeated Medeus. Yes, my prince. You do recognize this young man's name. He is indeed Anri, the first king of Altea. It has been 100 years since thos dark days. And now Medeus has appeared once again. Prince Marth! You are the chosen one. The last of Anri's line... Your father, King Cornelius, was defeated before he could accomplish his task. It is up to you now!

speaker: Gotoh
text: To make it this far, Marth... It is the measure of a true hero.

speaker: Marth
text: Sage Gotoh! Why have you come to this place?

speaker: Gotoh
text: Men are foolish... and I had sworn to let the affairs of the world proceed without me. But watching your struggles, I came to think perhaps I was too hasty in my judgment. I cannot defeat Medeus on my own. But I will happily lay his minions to rest. Go forth, he who has been chosen by the goddess... Altea's prince of light! Cast the Shadow Dragon back into the darkness! Bury him in the earth he crawled out from!

speaker: Medeus
text: Rebels that dare disturb my repose... be consumed by the flames of hell!

speaker: Medeus
text: Me? Defeated? By humans... Mere humans... Take this to heart, Altean prince, inheritor of the light... One day... I will rise anew... Never forget... As long as there is light... the darkness can never be extinguished!

speaker: Caeda
text: Marth... at long last, we can return to Talys!

speaker: Marth
text: Yes, we can. And I must report to your father. But after that, I will immediately head to Altea...

speaker: Caeda
text: Yes...

speaker: Marth
text: War has brought my land to ruin. We must not waste any time in rebuilding.

speaker: Nyna
text: Oh, Marth. Hehe. I see you are not one to speak easily of what is most precious to you. You are a hero! This is a challenge you must not shrink from! Hurry and tell her.

speaker: Marth
text: Princess Nyna! I- I would never... Well, how shall I put- Caeda?

speaker: Caeda
text: Oh! Y-yes?

speaker: Marth
text: Would... would you journey to Altea with me?

speaker: Caeda
text: Why... yes! I would love to.

speaker: Nyna
text: Prince Marth, your remarkable struggle has come to an end. You have saved us all. The cost of that victory, however... For you, it was far too much to bear. I am sorry.

speaker: Marth
text: Princess Nyna... It is my fault that Caeda was killed, not yours. Do not apologize. I will soon... No, as long as I do live... I will never forget her.

speaker: Nyna
text: It is as I suspected. Do not blame yourself... Perhaps for us, this victory could only come at the cost of those we loved. Sad as it may be, it is the fate the Fire Emblem has borne across generations...

speaker: Malledus
text: There, sire. Up on the mountains to the south, you can see Dolhr Keep.

speaker: Marth
text: And inside is Medeus, king of the earth dragons- the one they call the Shadow Dragon. ...Why doesn’t he leave the keep and face us?

speaker: Malledus
text: I recall Lord Gotoh saying his return is not yet complete; only within the keep’s walls can he maintain dragon form, where the power of the seal does not affect...

speaker: Marth
text: Power of the seal?

speaker: Malledus
text: Yes. I don’t really understand either, but it seems it was created by the deities to protect humans from the evil dragon tribes.

speaker: Marth
text: I have heard of this as well. It is mentioned in the legends of the guardian god, Naga. But I thought it was all just a myth. If the Binding Shield truly exists, then why has Medeus appeared?

speaker: Malledus
text: Oh, that I... Anyway, now is our chance, before he resurrects completely.

speaker: Marth
text: Yes. We've come all this way, and we're so close to returning peace. To Dolhr Keep, then! Let us put a stop to this war!

speaker: Old Man
text: A temple sits atop the mountain to the south. Deep inside, a central pillar stands... In front of it, Aum can be used to restore a life. Yes! Use it there, and you can greet a fallen friend.

speaker: Xemcel
text: This land, all of it- it belonged to us! Then you humans took it...defiled it!

speaker: Xemcel
text: Rrgh... Emperor... Medeus... Forgive your servant's weakness...

speaker: Medeus
text: Princeling! Do not think you have yet won! Though you dare approach me, I will not surrender! You will bear witness to the true power of the Earth Dragons... Yes... Come to me! I will cast you into the deepest pit of hell!

speaker: Morzas
text: Kee hee hee… So, Marth! You've come crawling back to your homeland… just to die! I am Lord Medeus's most formidable servant… Morzas of Basilisk! You're too late! TOO LATE! Your mother, Liza, has already breathed her last! And your sister, Elice, is in Gharnef's hands now! It's all my doing! If that angers you, why don't you see if you can defeat me? Kee hee hee!

speaker: Morzas
text: Kee hee... Witless human! None defy a mage-dragon and live to speak of it!

speaker: Morzas
text: Grrf... I stand... corrected...B ut you still lack the power... to defeat Medeus...

speaker: Malledus
text: Well done, Prince! With this, Altea has been liberated. The people are so happy… Just listen to all that cheering! Do you hear them? "Glory to Marth, the prince of light!"

speaker: Julian
text: Hey, Lena! Things are looking bad. We had better beat it! Sounds like the knights of Altea have arrived. This is our cue to get out of here! We're almost there, so come on!

speaker: Lena
text: I am sorry, but...I have lost my precious Mend staff. Until I find it, I cannot leave. Don't worry about me, Julian! You should flee while you can. I can use my Warp staff to send you somewhere safe.

speaker: Julian
text: I can't let you do that. If I leave you here, then why did I betray the bandits and rescue you? We can worry about your staff later! I promise I'll come back for it. Let's get while the getting's good. Focus on that!

speaker: Young Man
text: There are mercenaries about. Be careful. They're so skilled that they can fell you in one blow!

speaker: Man
text: Hunters are stronger attackers than archers, but they're weaker in defense. They should avoid close-range combat at all costs!

speaker: Man
text: Improve your Skill and you'll have a better chance at landing critical hits. Increase your Spd, meanwhile, and you'll find it easier to dodge enemy attacks.

speaker: Old Man
text: You youngsters sure do have stamina. Since you made it all the way up here, what say I give you this axe? Not bad, eh? Not so fast! This Devil Axe consumes the lives of those who wield it. If I were you, I wouldn't use it in battle! Mark my words!

speaker: Navarre
text: I feel bad killing you, but it was your mistake to come here. Now die!

speaker: Navarre
text: Fools...

speaker: Caeda
text: Navarre! Why has a swordsman on your worth fallen in with thieves?

speaker: Navarre
text: What was that? ...I have no business with women or children. Leave now!

speaker: Caeda
text: Please, help us put a stop to this pointless fighting. Lend us your strength! If you will not, then I will tell you... Do your worst. I am ready.

speaker: Navarre
text: ... I have vowed never to turn a blade on a woman. If you would risk your life to convince me, I suppose I have no choice. I will join you.

speaker: Reynard
text: Har. You must really want to die, comin’ into the Soothsires’ palace unbidden!

speaker: Reynard
text: Arrgh... One day it’ll be you!

speaker: Malledus
text: Prince, look! The bandits left 15,000G in the castle's vaults. We can use this money to supply ourselves with equipment. Tomorrow, we will arrive in Aurelis! For tonight, rest well.

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: King Jiol, they're ‘ere! The League is outside the Bastion!

speaker: Jiol
text: League? How dare you call them that! I see naught but a prince of ghosts and his pack of rebels.

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: B-beggin' your pardon, sire, but everybody calls 'em the League now. Altea and Aurelis and Archanea...The League of A's, you might say!

speaker: Jiol
text: Shut up, you idiot! Hmmm...So the princeling has returned. And he leads all the might of Archanea, with the Fire Emblem in hand...Did you send to Dolhr for reinforcements like I asked?

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: Of course, sire. Macedon's pegasus knights are on their way.

speaker: Jiol
text: Pegasus knights?! How am I supposed to stop the Lea- those REBELS with a handful of...of winged ponies! Send another messenger! Tell them we need Camus's Sable Order, or...or Michalis's Dragoons! Blast...I deserve the same protection as the rest of the Empire! Betraying Altean was Gharnef's idea! Let...let him fight the brat! Don't just stand there, DO something! I don't want to die! Do you understand?

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: Yes, your highness...

speaker: Young Man
text: They say that shops will all give you half off if you have a silver card… Sounds too good to be true if you ask me!

speaker: Young Man
text: I heard that once you reach LV.10, you can change jobs! Cavaliers can become paladins, mercenaries can become heroes… There's more but I forgot!

speaker: Camus
text: Are you Prince Marth of Altea? I have a request of you. This tome belongs to one Bishop Boah of Archanea. Heimler of Grust got hold of it. It has come to be in my possession. Please return it to the bishop for me. One more thing… Watch over Princess Nyna. Your attention to this would put my mind at ease. I shall take my leave of you. We will meet again…

speaker: Palla
text: I am pleased to meet you, Prince Marth. I am Palla of the Whitewings. As soon as we heard that Princess Maria was safe, my sister Catria and I left Macedon. Just as she promised you, Catria and I will join your fight alongside Princess Minerva. However, our youngest sister Est still has not returned from Grust. If she makes it back, the three of us will show you how we can light up the battlefield together!

speaker: Catria
text: Hello, Prince Marth. It has been a while. Do you remember me? I am Catria. I was waiting for Princess Minerva's order before joining your army. I look forward to fighting together. I will do all that I can.

speaker: Midia
text: Astram! So this is what you've been up to...

speaker: Astram
text: Midia! You're really here! I'm so glad you're safe. I've missed you...

speaker: Midia
text: It seems you don't know yet... Altea's army has liberated the capital. We were set free and have joined their fight. There is no need to cooperate with the enemy any longer!

speaker: Astram
text: What wonderful news! I will resume my fight against Dolhr!

speaker: Midia
text: We can be together again! Promise me that you will never leave my side.

speaker: Astram
text: Midia... In the time since we last met...

speaker: Midia
text: Yes, Astram? What is it?

speaker: Astram
text: I can't help but notice how you've matured while we were apart...

speaker: Astram
text: I’m sorry… This is for my lover… Forgive me…

speaker: Astram
text: Midia… Forgive me…

speaker: Catria
text: Wait, I’m looking for Lord Marth.

speaker: Catria
text: Why…

speaker: Palla
text: Wait, I’m looking for Lord Marth.

speaker: Palla
text: How ruthless...

speaker: Jiol
text: Grrr... Altean rabble! I should have killed you stragglers back when I had the chance!

speaker: Jiol
text: Thus falls... the mighty kingdom... of Gra... My daughter... Sheena... you must... for me...

speaker: Malledus
text: We searched every inch of the castle but could not find the blade of light… As the rumors suggest, Gharnef must have taken it to Khadein.

speaker: Marth
text: I see... Without Falchion, we cannot hope to defeat Medeus. Altea is so close…but we must go to Khadein instead. Disappointing, but I have to tell the troops.

speaker: Man
text: This here is Knorda. You're in Archanea now! Don't forget to drop by the armories and the shops. You should find some good stuff if you look around!

speaker: Young Man
text: At the edge of town, there's a slave market. If you look, you'll see that it's full of kids pulled from who-knows-where...

speaker: Woman
text: I apologize... Since Archanea fell, this town has become desolate. It's not safe to walk outside with all the ruffians about!

speaker: Woman
text: I hate war... It's always the women and children who suffer. You should stop fighting. Get back to those you love as soon as you can. Parthia, the bow of flame, Gradivus, the lance that pierces stone... And the magic blade that can only be wielded by the chosen, Mercurius. Those that obtain them are said to be blessed by the gods.

speaker: Old Man
text: Three ancient weapons known as the Regalia have been passed down through the generations of House Archanea: Parthia, the bow of flame; Gradivus, the lance that pierces stone; and Mercurius, the spectral sword. Only those blessed by the gods may lay hands on them- or so it goes.

speaker: Old Man
text: No person can defend themselves against the breath of a dragon. Any armour is useless, so fighting head on is very dangerous.

speaker: Ruffian
text: You lookin' to buy a slave? All's I have left are some scrawny brats, but I'll cut you a deal.

speaker: Marth
text: Look at these poor children! What a vile man you are. If you value your life, you'll unchain them immediately and get out of my sight!

speaker: Ruffian
text: It's the Altean army! I'm done for!

speaker: Marth
text: What a horrible ordeal you all must have suffered... But it's all right now. You can return to your homes. You there, why haven't you left?

speaker: Linde
text: I...I don't have anywhere to go.

speaker: Marth
text: You're a girl, aren't you? Yet you're disguised as a young boy.

speaker: Linde
text: I am the daughter of Archbishop Miloah. I disguised myself to escape from Gharnef. But I was caught by a slave merchant when I ran away.

speaker: Marth
text: So you're the archbishop's daughter! It's good that we found you. Princess Nyna has been worried sick! From today, we will stand beside you. I will not let anything like this happen to you again.

speaker: Linde
text: Prince Marth, let me fight at your side. I have the Aura tome my father entrusted to me... If Princess Nyna allows me to help, I will use it. I want to take revenge for what Gharnef did to my father. I must defeat him.

speaker: Jeorge
text: Greetings, Prince Marth! I am Jeorge, a sniper of Archanea. I was captured when Archanea was defeated, but, with effort, I escaped. I have been awaiting you. I hear Princess Nyna is under your protection. I wish to join you. With my silver bow in hand, I will expend every effort to set my land free.

speaker: Khozen
text: Burn...! Burn, till your blood boils and your flesh cooks!

speaker: Khozen
text: Emperor Medeus...I have failed you...

speaker: Marth
text: Look, Princess Nyna. It's the Ageless Palace.

speaker: Nyna
text: I am overjoyed to see it! Finally, I have made it home. Many of our warriors are still imprisioned within. We must hurry and save them!

speaker: Marth
text: Of course. We will storm the palace before enemy reinforcements arrive!

speaker: Emereus
text: The rebels have made it into the castle? Impossible! Grr... Well, we will show them! Knights, form up and rush the intruders! Archers, defend the throne! Thieves, loot the castle's treasures and prepare to withdraw! Hear me! Do not let them set one foot into this chamber! Not one!

speaker: Wendell
text: Prince! I am Wendell, a bishop of Khadein. We are a peaceful people. But our pleas were met only with cruelty by Gharnef as he seized the city. Thanks to his dark influence, many mages have now allied themselves with Dolhr. Please, with the strength of your forces, find a way to put an end to Gharnef's ambitions.

speaker: Merric
text: Oh! Master Wendell? Yes, it's you!

speaker: Wendell
text: Ah, Merric! How have you been, lad? You certainly look well.

speaker: Merric
text: I was able to find Prince Marth of Altea! And I have joined his army as well. We are fighting the tyranny of Dolhr! Why are you here, Master?

speaker: Wendell
text: How can I say this… Sadly, Khadein has fallen into darkness. A fiend called Gharnef has seized control. He has turned the city toward the shadow… I could not bear to serve him, so I fled on my own.

speaker: Merric
text: What awful news! Master, please… Consider lending us your strength. If Gharnef serves Dolhr, he is our enemy! We will find a way to take Khadein back. I know the prince would be overjoyed to have so great a bishop as you as an ally, Master.

speaker: Wendell
text: Hmm… Though I deplore violence, I cannot see another path… Very well, Merric. I will join your fight. Please let the prince know I am at his service.

speaker: Rickard
text: Thanks for saving me! Hey, wait a second… Aren't you the prince of Altea? My name is Rickard. I am but a humble thief. I came to loot this castle but ended up getting caught. Since you helped me out, I'll return the favor!

speaker: Julian
text: Rickard? It can't be! What are you doing here?

speaker: Rickard
text: Julian! It's been too long since I've seen you, Chief. I came to this castle to steal a few things. And wouldn't you know it...I got a little sloppy. And what brings you here?

speaker: Julian
text: Me? As of today, I've washed my hands of thievery. I'm on the side of what's good and just.

speaker: Rickard
text: Ha! I bet I know the truth behind this change of heart. Beauties have always been your weak point.

speaker: Julian
text: N-not a chance! The spirit of justice awakened within me! Look, don't worry about it. Just join up with us!

speaker: Rickard
text: There you go again, trying to make up my mind for me. Since you're the one asking... Well, why not? It's settled! I'll lend you a hand. But I'll take a cut of the loot as payment!

speaker: Wendell
text: I don't like fighting. You can do as you please...

speaker: Wendell
text: This is regrettable...

speaker: Rickard
text: Has anyone seen my big bro, Julian?

speaker: Rickard
text: Crap, I blundered.

speaker: Emereus
text: Blast! They're upon me! Why didn't those idiot soldiers stop them?!

speaker: Emereus
text: Rrgh... Why... ?

speaker: Nyna
text: You must be Prince Marth. You have done well to make it here. I am the princess of Archanea, Nyna. Though Archanea has long protected this world, Dolhr overwhelmed us, throwing all into chaos. I cannot fight. Marth, I beg you... Please, lead the forces of good and defeat Dolhr! You must liberate all of the lands Dolhr has occupied!

speaker: Marth
text: Of course, Princess Nyna. Altea's allegiance to Archanea is steadfast. Moreover, as the prince of Altea, it is my destiny to defeat Medeus.

speaker: Nyna
text: I thank you, Marth. I will now entrust you with this treasure... The Fire Emblem is given to one with the strength to save the world when my royal family cannot. With this, you will be able to open chests containing invaluable treasures. The battles you face will test your every skill. But fight as hard as you can. Return light to this world!

speaker: Nyna
text: So this is your country, Altea...

speaker: Marth
text: Yes. Dolhr has occupied it for two years now. I escaped to Talys only thanks to my sister Elice's help. And in my place, she was captured by Dolhr. I have no idea where she is now. I vow that I will do whatever I can to rescue her! All right, everyone! It is time to take back Altea! Let us begin!

speaker: Old Man
text: I have something very important to tell you. Listen well! In the northwest of this land, you will find two villages. A paladin named Arran dwells in the western village. In the easterly one, there is a hero named Samson. Both of them are fine men. The problem is the feud between their villages... Due to this rivalry, you can only add one of them to your ranks. Think hard about this before visiting either village.

speaker: Young Man
text: Psst… If you have a VIP card, you can access a members-only shop. Its location is a secret. Even I don't know it!

speaker: Man
text: I heard a rumor that the prison to the east holds a young man called Xane. He isn't from around here... That's not all... I hear he holds a wondrous power.

speaker: Woman
text: I am very glad to see that the Altean army has returned. Now this country can return to the peaceful days of old.

speaker: Woman
text: Princess Elice was taken away somewhere by a bishop called Gharnef. How sad for the prince... I hope she's all right.

speaker: Young Man
text: If you intend to use the Devil Sword, be careful. It's a powerful weapon but a danger to its owner.

speaker: Middle-Aged Man
text: Three orbs are enshrined at the Fane of Raman, each brimming with power. What sort of power, none can say. Well, except those who have wielded it, right?

speaker: Arran
text: I am Arran. Once, I was a knight captain. I left that life behind me, but if you have true need of my strength, I will join you. The feud between these two villages is bitter. If our neighbors hear you visited us, they will bar their gates. If you had hoped to recruit the hero Samson, I am sorry.

speaker: Samson
text: I'm Samson. I used to be famous as a gladiator. That's behind me now. I'm just living my life here. If you need me, though, I'll head out with you. The feud between these two villages is bad! If our neighbors hear you visited us, they'll close their gates. If word gets around, you won't be able to recruit Arran.

speaker: Xane
text: Hey there, Prince! Thanks for saving me. The name's Xane. I come from a faraway land. My people can transform into anybody. Dolhr found out and demanded I join them! I refused. I'd never help those villains! I'd be happy to help you fight them though!

speaker: Xane
text: Hey! Wait, I’m not an enemy. Don’t fight me!

speaker: Hollstadt
text: Well done, rabble. Anyone else would be dead by now. A shame you must end your campaign right here, before your own gates!

speaker: Hollstadt
text: Rrgh! General Camus... The rest... is in your... hands...

speaker: Marth
text: Soldiers of Altea, and everyone who has lent us your strength…you have my gratitude. Thanks to you, we have finally taken our country back from Dolhr. Many enemies still remain inside the castle, however! Do not drop your guard!

speaker: Zharov
text: Princess Minerva, what brings you here? You've left your post: not very wise. Might I remind you, poor conduct on your part could have repercussions on how...comfortable...your sister remains.

speaker: Minerva
text: I am aware of my sister, thank you. ...I did not come to make trouble. Just let me see Maria, for a little while. She's only a child, General. Think of what she must be going through.

speaker: Zharov
text: Impossible, I'm afraid. She is a hostage. If your sister's well-being concerns you, then start following orders.

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: General! Grave news! The rebel army has been sighted east of Castle Deil!

speaker: Zharov
text: What?! Why in creation would the rebels come here? Blast...Order the Dragoons to sortie! And don't forget to send word to the main army. We need reinforcements!

speaker: Minerva
text: Rebels...? Then Marth has arrived...

speaker: Old Man
text: There were three great bishops in this land. Miloah, the Master of Aura. Gharnef, The Dark Pontifex. And Gotoh, the White Sage. But now that Miloah has been defeated, no one can stand up to Gharnef.

speaker: Old Man
text: The levin sword... It is said that they who wield it can loose lightning that will crush even heavy armor.

speaker: Man
text: Snipers are skilled bow users. If you carelessly let them get close, you could get killed.

speaker: Old Man
text: Beware of ballistae near the northern fort. They can attack from far away.

speaker: Maria
text: Ah... You must be Prince Marth! (Wow! He's so dashing!) Thank you for saving me! You have to tell my older sister that I am safe! She must be worried... One other thing... I would like to join you, Prince. Let me stay by your side! Oh, please don't say no!

speaker: Minerva
text: Greetings, Prince Marth. I am Minerva of Macedon. For saving Maria, you have my thanks. I had no choice but to be your enemy. I regret that very much. Still, many in Macedon do support Dolhr, including my elder brother Michalis. To me, though, Dolhr is responsible for my father's death. I seek revenge for that. I must also worry aobut my troops, however. Especially the three Whitewings: Palla, Catria, and Est. Dolhr feared our rebellion and separated us. If they knew I was safe, they would happily join your ranks. How I detest Dolhr for trampling Macedon underfoot. Please, allow us to join your fight.

speaker: Maria
text: Ah… Minerva, sister…

speaker: Minerva
text: Maria was just a hostage. Why did you… I won’t forgive you!!

speaker: Minerva
text: I am looking for Prince Marth.

speaker: Minerva
text: Maria…

speaker: Zharov
text: Grrr... Must I do everything myself? Bah! You'll not get past me, rebel!

speaker: Zharov
text: They're a force... to be reckoned... with... Rrgh...

speaker: Nyna
text: Prince Marth, do you know of the archbishop of Archanea, Miloah?

speaker: Marth
text: I have heard he was a great man and the wielder of Aura, a powerful spell. He protected Archanea. It is my understanding that he fell fighting Gharnef, who has allied with Dolhr.

speaker: Nyna
text: That is so. But he had a daughter named Linde. It is said she inherited the magic of Aura. Unfortunately, we do not know where Linde is now. No one does. I fear that something terrible has befallen her. Please, seek her out. Her father is no more, so we must protect her now. For Archanea's sake!

speaker: Nyna
text: Prince Marth. About Grust, there is something I wish to tell you. You should know that Grust's famous knights are led by General Camus. When the Dolhr-Grust allied forces seized control of Archanea three years ago, the entire royal family was killed, save me. I was given into Grust’s custody- the custody of the Sable Order, to be more specific. I am told Dolhr wished for my execution- and with it the end of the holy lineage of House Archanea- and Grust was willing to comply. Camus protected me, knowing he risked incurring the wrath of the Shadow Dragon. He was the one who eventually arranged for my escape to Aurelis. Afterwards, he was only held captive until recently, because he had won many victories for Dolhr. I hated him, too, at first. But in time, I found my hatred tempered by the compassion he showed me, my feelings... changed. If possible, I don't want to fight against him. All I wish is to see him again...

speaker: Old Man
text: It's good to see you, Prince Marth! Is my granddaughter Lena in good health? Please... give her this staff, Hammerne. It has been passed down in our family for generations. It can repair some weapons and items, but not all. Be sure to tell her to be careful when using it.

speaker: Lorenz
text: No victory here can give Grust back her glory.

speaker: Lorenz
text: This, too, must be fate.

speaker: Caeda
text: General Lorenz, I am Caeda of Talys. My father told me much of you.

speaker: Lorenz
text: Princess Caeda! You have grown into a beautiful young lady. Yes, your father was a great help to me.

speaker: Caeda
text: General... You did not truly want to become an ally of Dolhr, did you? Why then did you not put a stop to the alliance?

speaker: Lorenz
text: Grust's king is a coward. He fears the power of Dolhr.

speaker: Caeda
text: Dolhr's aim is to conquer all of mankind with an army of manaketes. For the sake of all of the innocents, including those in Grust, we must put a stop to that ambition. Stop fighting us. Instead, join us!

speaker: Lorenz
text: My feelings have not changed... I fought only because I was ordered to. But it may be time to act. Very well, Princess. It is painful for me to betray my homeland, but I will join you in this fight!

speaker: Est
text: You must be Prince Marth! I am Est of Macedon. We finally get to meet! I went and retrieved the sword Mercurius that Grust stole from Archanea. It is not for us that I obtained it. It's for you! Please make use of it.

speaker: Marth
text: General Camus, I have no wish to fight you. You know this battle is pointless; surely you must! Nyna also wants to see you. Please forget about the past, and drop your sword.

speaker: Camus
text: Prince Marth... It's already too late. So long as Grust continues to support Dolhr’s ambitions, it does not matter what I know or think. I am a knight; I have a duty to fight for my motherland’s glory till the very end. And besides, I caused your father's death. Why don't we just end everything here?

speaker: Nyna
text: Wait, Camus... I beg of you. I do not wish to see that the two of you fight. It is... it is unbearable. Please, Camus, help us... no, help me.

speaker: Camus
text: I am sorry, Princess. Were my heart my master, I would do exactly as you say. But… Betraying my homeland, right as it nears ruin, is something that I cannot do. Nyna... Our days together may have been short, but I was very happy.

speaker: Camus
text: I pity you, for as long as I wield Gradivus, you have no hope of defeating me. Retreat and avoid this fate.

speaker: Camus
text: My dear... Nyna... Farewell...

speaker: Marth
text: Princess Nyna... I am sorry. I could not do what you asked.

speaker: Nyna
text: Marth... It is I who should apologize for putting you through this. In truth, since the moment I entrusted the Fire Emblem to you, I knew this would happen. I saw that once the royal family was restored by the Fire Emblem, I would lose something precious to me. Our land has a legend of the emblem, Artemis's Curse, that foretold this...

speaker: Gharnef
text: What? The dregs of Archanea have come to challenge my kingdom? Ha ha ha... Really, do they think people have not tried before? So long as I possess this Imhullu magic, they cannot snuff my life out. No one can. As for the White Sage... He will trouble me no longer. With the dragon-goddess right where I want her, in the Fane of Raman, there is no way for Gotoh's Starlight to disperse the shadows that guard me.

speaker: Man
text: You can't hope to fight Gharnef! His evil magic Imhullu protects him. Only Gotoh's Starlight can break his evil spell… But you didn't hear this from me! Get out of here!

speaker: Young Man
text: Strong armor is no use against magic. Have a curate use the spell Barrier instead or Pure Water!

speaker: Gharnef
text: You must not value your life very much… I will show you the true terror of the darkest of magic, Imhullu!

speaker: Gharnef
text: I don't have time to play with you, little prince! If you want Falchion, you'll have to come to Thabes!

speaker: Gotoh
text: Can you hear me, Prince Marth? I am the sage Gotoh. Through magic, I have reached out to you. Gharnef is too much for you. Listen to me if you want to defeat him! Gharnef and Miloah were both my students. But Gharnef stole Imhullu from me and disappeared. I believe he has Falchion as well… With both Falchion and Imhullu, he fears nothing, not even Dolhr. He aims to rule the world! As long as he wields Imhullu, he cannot be challenged. However, there is one way to defeat him. Bring me the Lightsphere and the Starsphere. If you can do this, I will grant you the one and only spell that can defeat him, Starlight!

speaker: Hardin
text: Princess Nyna, the Altean Army has apapeared on the opposite side of the river.

speaker: Nyna
text: Oh, Hardin, have they really? So Prince Marth has come...

speaker: Hardin
text: Finally, we can build a force to fight back. Princess, it is dangerous here. Please wait for the prince inside the fortress. Together with Altea, we will retake the castle!

speaker: Old Man
text: There are many treasures within the castle walls. However, if you do not have a thief in your army, you will not be able to open the chests!

speaker: Woman
text: I hear that the shops in Port Warren sell many rare items. If you plan to travel there, don't waste your gold beforehand!

speaker: Woman
text: Many foes wait inside the fortresses, ready to enter the battle. Block them so they can't get out!

speaker: Young Man
text: Boy! What's that look on your face? Haven't you ever seen a backwoods village like this before? Speaking of rare sights... When I was last in Pyrathi, I saw a manakete! An old man stood there, but suddenly, he turned into a dragon! What a shock... Truth told, I was scared out of my wits at the sight of it! I've heard rumors about the dragonkin, that some survived to this day. Still, I never thought I'd see a manakete with my own eyes! What are you looking at? Oh, this? I picked it up on my trip. It's unusual, this glowing stone... I have no idea what it's for, so you can have it! It makes me uncomfortable anyway. What a nice young man! I hope we can speak again.

speaker: Merric
text: Prince Marth! Finally we meet again.

speaker: Marth
text: Merric? is that you? What a surprise.

speaker: Merric
text: I was studying magic in Khadein when war came. I left the city then and have been looking for you.

speaker: Marth
text: I'm glad you sought me out. We could use someone with your talents in our army. Will you join us?

speaker: Merric
text: Of course I will. I learned a strong spell in Khadein called Excalibur. I will demonstrate it in battle!

speaker: Lena
text: Matthis? Is that you?

speaker: Matthis
text: Lena?! What are you doing on a battlefield?

speaker: Lena
text: I was attacked by bandits in the Teeth while tending to the sick there, and these people saved me. The real question is, what are YOU doing on a battlefield- least of all this one!

speaker: Matthis
text: I’m not here by choice, sister of mine. Since you left, Macedon has only gotten worse and worse. They forced me to enlist- you know I hate warfare, but it was into the army or onto the chopping block.

speaker: Lena
text: Shame on you, Matthis. If you’re going to fight, then at least fight for something you believe in. Medon has done terrible things: marrying their might to Doluna, helping them torment people…Brother, it’s not too late. You could join Altea’s forces. They’re good people you know. Prince Marth would welcome you. They all would.

speaker: Matthis
text: …All right, then. If I’m gonna to die, I’d rather die as one of the dashing than one of the dastardly. You know, Lena, you always were the reliable one and now you’re all grown up…I thought for sure you’d have already settled down with your one true love.

speaker: Lena
text: T-true love? I’ve…I’ve met no such man, Matthis.

speaker: Matthis
text: Hmm, is that so? I’ll bet you haven’t… Well, you just be careful. There are plenty of thieves out there who would steal a girl’s heart.

speaker: Lena
text: Huh? But...

speaker: Matthis
text: Well, Lena, don’t push yourself too hard. I’ll just go and say my farewells to the Macedonian army.

speaker: Matthis
text: Lena...where have you gone? Even if it could be just once more...I had hoped to see you again.

speaker: Matthis
text: Lena... Forgive this useless brother.

speaker: Merach
text: Princess Minerva bade me guard this castle in her absence. You shall not take it so long as I stand!

speaker: Merach
text: Heh… You think you’ve won, wretch? Far from it…

speaker: Aurelis King
text: Well met, Prince Marth! Princess Nyna has taken refuge in a fortress, but you will see her soon. Many enemies await you in the castle. You face many dangers. Do be careful.

speaker: Michalis
text: Lord Gotoh, the League has begun its attack. I wish for you to move someplace safe until the fighting has ended.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Mmm... I understand. But Michalis, you truly are a fool.

speaker: Michalis
text: ...! Why did you call me a fool!?

speaker: Gotoh
text: You loved your younger sister so much. It pains me to see you quarrel. If you and Minerva had worked as one, Macedon might have become a great kingdom- greater even than Archanea, perhaps. But instead, you let Gharnef trick you into destroying your family, and your kingdom with it.

speaker: Michalis
text: ...I cannot undo what is done. My father’s blood will always be on my hands, just as Minerva’s betrayal of her brother and country will be on hers. And Macedon has not been destroyed, not yet. So long as I carry Iote's Shield, the League’s arrows cannot fell me. Right now, my only goal is to gut that Altean prince who leads the League. My pride as Macedonian king rests upon it!

speaker: Gotoh
text: I see... Then we’ve nothing more to discuss, have we? Go! Michalis, go and punish yourself, for the crime of killing your own father!!

speaker: Man
text: A great sage lives in the village to the north. He keeps to himself though! I've never met him. Nobody has!

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth! You have done well to make it here. I am Gotoh. As instructed, you have brought me the Lightsphere and Starsphere. I now grant you the only magic capable of countering Imhullu, Starlight. Take it and bring an end to the wickedness of the Dark Pontifex, Gharnef.

speaker: Gotoh
text: Marth! You have not heeded my words! I require the Starsphere and Lightsphere both. Without them, I cannot create Starlight for you. I do not think you can defeat Gharnef... If you cannot claim Falchion from Gharnef, you have little hope of defeating Medeus. If you still wish to try, you must gain much in experience and reach the pinnacle of your strength. That is not all... You must also gather mighty blades like Gradivus, Mercurius, and the Devil Axe. Unless you make these preparations, Medeus's defeat is scarcely possible. This is the harshest road to victory. Are you truly willing to walk this path? Think long and hard on this decision. Choose wisely.

speaker: Michalis
text: Damn you, Minerva! I will not be put down! Now, quake in terror before my wyvern knights!

speaker: Michalis
text: Made it this far, have you? Don’t gloat yet. My Dragoons and I still rule these skies!

speaker: Michalis
text: My dreams… have been shattered… Forgive me… citizens of Macedon...

speaker: Malledus
text: Prince! We have discovered the location of Thabes! Far north of Khadein in the desert of Mamorthod lies the city of illusion... None who have entered Thabes have returned... or so it is said. Prince... what should we do?

speaker: Marth
text: Malledus...in order to retrieve Falchion and save my sister, we must step boldly into danger. Gharnef! I vow to liberate the beauteous land you despoil!

speaker: Midia
text: Bishop Boah, do you hear the confusion the palace? Do you think something is afoot?

speaker: Boah
text: Perhaps Princess Nyna was able to recruit an army and has returned...

speaker: Midia
text: Do you really think so? We might be saved!

speaker: Boah
text: Perhaps, but the enemy won't let us go without a fight... And without our weapons, we are helpless.

speaker: Midia
text: But this is the perfect chance to rid Archanea of its foes! I am willing to take that chance, no matter what might happen to me.

speaker: Boah
text: Your fighting spirit is so strong, my dear! But if you perished, Astram would surely weep.

speaker: Midia
text: Yes... I do wish I could see him once more before the end. But if I cannot...

speaker: Boah
text: If that is your wish, Midia, you must fight as hard as you can and never give up!

speaker: Volzhin
text: Rebel pup! You dare defy Dolhr? Then writhe in the fires of Bolganone!

speaker: Volzhin
text: Do not think...you have won... Dolhr...is undying... Nngh!

speaker: Nyna
text: You have my gratitude, Prince. It is all thanks to you that I was able to return to my home. This shining bow is called Parthia. It is one of three weapons passed down by the royal family. Our enemies have stolen the lance Gradivus and the sword Mercurius. If you can obtain these weapons, their great power will make your fight that much easier...
